snippet: Many émigrés are hoping that a new era of openness between the United States and Havana could help remove obstacles to recovering what they lost. But obstacles remain.
abstract: Many Spanish citizens who fled Cuba during Communist revolution are seeking compensation or restitution for seized assets now that there is new era of openness; are hoping that United States will be able to help press their expropriation claims, which have been stalled because Cuba already paid Spain $40 million compensation as part of 1986 agreement.
lead_paragraph: Many émigrés are hoping that a new era of openness between the United States and Havana could help remove obstacles to recovering what they lost. But obstacles remain.

headline.main: Spanish Look to Havana to Repay an Old Debt
headline.print_headline: Spanish Look to Havana to Repay an Old Debt
